title: Ticket #3514: Cluster ads qedit'able via x.-1
description:
As an optimization, job ads are stored as a cluster ad + proc ad. If a job's id is 1.0 the cluster ad is 01.-1 and proc ad is 1.0.

It is possible to qedit the cluster ad using id 1.-1. All cluster ad changes are applied to every proc ad and thus every job ad in the cluster. 

$ echo queue 10 | condor_submit -a cmd=/bin/sleep -a args=1d -a requirements=false
Submitting job(s)..........
10 job(s) submitted to cluster 1.

In ~condor/spool/job_queue.log -

103 0.0 NextClusterNum 2
101 01.-1 Job Machine
101 1.0 Job Machine
...

$ condor_qedit 307.-1 requirements true
Set attribute "requirements".

$ condor_q 307 -l | grep ^Requirements
Requirements = true
Requirements = true
Requirements = true
Requirements = true
Requirements = true
Requirements = true
Requirements = true
Requirements = true
Requirements = true
Requirements = true

In ~condor/spool/job_queue.log -
...
105
103 0307.-1 requirements true
106
...

It's not likely that this is intentional. It may or may not be dangerous - my notes from a year ago suggest it can be dangerous, but don't elaborate on why.

If nothing else this is implementation information leakage that can become an unintended aspect of the qedit API.
